Small question: Is there absolutely ZERO redeeming quality to the void?

I figured Kai'sa would sort of show a side where the void could be something used by people who are willing to forsake humanity for power (And Malz too) but right now it just kinda sounds like there is nothing good, at ALL, in the void.

I understand where you're coming from. Honestly with so many anti heroes and people fighting for a greater purpose and the mind set of "Willing to walk through Hell for a Heavenly Cause" being prominent through so many franchise's lore. It's refreshing to see something as Eldritch and purely evil as The Void.

Cosmic horror and 'pure evil' are mutually exclusive things.

The hallmark of cosmic horror is that it's amoral and often completely oblivious to the destruction it causes.  It's like a dude destroying an anthill to repave his driveway.  There's no malice in the destruction of all those ants, the guy might not have even noticed they exist.

Pure evil is for demons.

Hm. Possible but imo unlikely.

The entire point of unleashing the Void was to kill the (i think a dozen?) Ascended that had come to destroy Icathia. If anyone was around for that it would be Nasus or Renekton, and the former noted that Sivir's blade once belonged to the leader of the Ascended Host (who I think was a cat lady like the one in the story?). But Bloodlines implied that Nasus was there when that leader perished, and we never see anyone like Nasus in Where Icathia Once Stood. And I can't honestly imagine that Nasus would abandon the other Ascended while there was a chance to stop the Void (see the bird-man's last attempts)
